 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֳדָם‎</span><sub>42</sub> **preposition** ==before== (so Old Aramaic, Nabataean, Palmyrene, etc. ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>360 f.</sup>), [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קָדָם‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; properly a substantive ***the front***, compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***the front***; for √ see Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קדם‎</span>); — suffix <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קָדָמַי‎</span> [[Dan.2.9|Dan 2:9]] +, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָ֑י‎</span>- v[[Dan.2.6|Dan 2:6]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קדמיך‎</span> [[BDB#Kt|Kt]], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֳדָמָךְ‎</span> [[BDB#Qr|Qr]], [[Dan.5.23|Dan 5:23]]; [[Dan.6.23|Dan 6:23]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֳדָמוֺהִי‎</span> [[Dan.4.5|Dan 4:5]] + (compare Nerab <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קדמוה‎</span>, [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>189</sup>); 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קדמיה‎</span> [[BDB#Kt|Kt]], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֳדָמַהּ‎</span> [[BDB#Qr|Qr]], [[Dan.7.7|Dan 7:7]]; [[Dan.7.8|Dan 7:8]]; [[Dan.7.20|Dan 7:20]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֳדָמֵיהוֺן‎</span> [[Dan.4.4|Dan 4:4]] — 

**1.** ***before*** (= Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לפְנֵי‎</span>), especially in the phrases ***to answer, pray, say, etc., before*** a superior (as more respectful than ***to***), [[Dan.2.9|Dan 2:9]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְמֵאמַד קֳדָמַי‎</span>, v[[Dan.2.10|Dan 2:10]] v[[Dan.2.11|Dan 2:11]] v[[Dan.2.27|Dan 2:27]]; [[Dan.6.11|Dan 6:11]] (see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]), v.[[Dan.6.12|Dan 6:12]] v.[[Dan.6.13|Dan 6:13]] v.[[Dan.6.14|Dan 6:14]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֱרִי ק‎</span> [[Ezra.4.18|Ezra 4:18]]; [[Ezra.4.23|Ezra 4:23]]; [[Ezra.5.23|Ezra 5:23]] (twice in verse); with <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שְׁפַר‎</span> to ***seem fair*** [[Dan.3.32|Dan 3:32]]; [[Dan.6.2|Dan 6:2]] after verbs of motion, ***in before***, [[Dan.2.24|Dan 2:24]]; [[Dan.2.25|Dan 2:25]]; [[Dan.3.13|Dan 3:13]]; [[Dan.4.3|Dan 4:3]] +; of time [[Dan.7.7|Dan 7:7]]. 

**2.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןקֳֿדָם‎</span> ***from before*** ( = <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִלִּפְנֵי‎</span>, but as used in ***late*** Hebrew, [[Esth.1.19|Esth 1:19]]; [[Esth.4.8|Esth 4:8]]), with <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קַבֵּל‎</span> [[Dan.2.6|Dan 2:6]], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בְּעָא‎</span> v[[Dan.2.18|Dan 2:18]] of a decree, [[Dan.6.27|Dan 6:27]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןקֳֿדָמִי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שִֹׁים טְעֵם‎</span> (\|\| <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִנִּי‎</span> [[Dan.3.29|Dan 3:29]] +), compare [[Dan.2.15|Dan 2:15]]; [[Ezra.7.14|Ezra 7:14]] of God, [[Dan.5.24|Dan 5:24]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןקֳֿדָמוֺהִי שְׁלִיחַ פַּסָּא דַּייְֿדָא‎</span>, [[Dan.7.10|Dan 7:10]] (so very often in [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]], [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>Sm lxx. f.</sup> lxxiii). Also = Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִפְּנֵי‎</span>, with to ***fear*** [[Dan.5.19|Dan 5:19]]; [[Dan.6.27|Dan 6:27]], be ***rooted up*** [[Dan.7.8|Dan 7:8]], ***fall*** v[[Dan.7.20|Dan 7:20]].
